info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 18 at 9:37PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A snow squall will affect Henderson...Southwestern Rock island... Mercer...Northern Hancock...Warren...Van buren...Southern Keokuk... Southern Washington...Southwestern Muscatine...Jefferson...Henry... Des moines...Louisa...Lee...Scotland and Northwestern Clark counties through 1030 PM CST... At 935 PM CST, a snow squall was located along a line extending from Richland to Muscatine, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Snow, visibilities less than a quarter of a mile and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar and observations. IMPACTS...Snow covered surfaces including roadways, bridges, overpasses, and sidewalks. Locations impacted include... Burlington, Muscatine, Fort Madison, Fairfield, Monmouth, Mount Pleasant, Washington, Aledo, Wapello, Columbus Junction, Memphis, Oquawka, Nauvoo, Keosauqua, West Burlington, Burgess, New London, Mediapolis, Winfield and Roseville. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this snow squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads could lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your location. A rapid drop in temperatures will lead to the rapid formation of black ice on area roadways. Black ice is nearly impossible to see and roadways may appear wet. Please use extreme caution, especially on bridges, overpasses and around curves. Allow plenty of stopping distance and avoid braking suddenly.
